name: Marketing Competitive Analysis
description: Analyze competitor marketing strategies, messaging, positioning, and tactics. Identify opportunities for differentiation and inform marketing strategy. Includes website analysis, ad monitoring, content audit, and social presence review.

currentProcess.description: Define competitive set and analysis scope

aiProcess.toolRationale: Perplexity can analyze competitor websites and public messaging
tips: Search for '[competitor] value proposition' and '[competitor] messaging'
Look for recent press releases and announcements

aiProcess.toolRationale: Perplexity researches content themes and top performers
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Content strategy summary with themes and gaps
tips: Search for '[competitor] blog topics' and top-ranking content
Identify content gaps they're not covering

aiProcess.toolRationale: Perplexity finds ad examples and campaign mentions
aiProcess.expectedOutput: Summary of recent ad campaigns and messaging themes
tips: Search for '[competitor] ads' and '[competitor] marketing campaign'
Check Facebook Ad Library for active ads

aiProcess.toolRationale: Claude excels at strategic synthesis and opportunity identification
tips: Provide all raw research from previous steps
Ask for both offensive and defensive recommendations
Request specific sections: positioning, content, advertising, opportunities

aiProcess.expectedOutput: Final competitive analysis ready for stakeholders

whyItMatters: Understanding competitors is essential for differentiation and market positioning. Good competitive analysis reveals opportunities your competitors are missing and threats you need to address. It informs messaging, content strategy, and campaign planning.
commonMistakes: Tracking too many competitors - focus on 3-5 key players
Describing without analyzing - what does this mean for US?
One-time analysis - competition changes; make it recurring
Copying competitors - use insights to differentiate, not imitate
No action items - analysis without recommendations is useless
tips: Use AI to quickly summarize competitor positioning from their website
Create a competitive monitoring template you update quarterly
Ask AI to identify 'what competitors are NOT doing' - that's your opportunity
Build a competitive swipe file of ads and content you admire
sources: Perplexity Research - Competitive intelligence for marketers
